event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: The platform administrator should investigate and see if there is some other hardware fault that might possibly be related to this fault. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a SC chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A non-fatal uncorrectable internal error related to the SC chip.

No immediate action is taken as a result of this fault.

The type of fatal internal error within an SC chip that can be
detected is a failure to deliver an XIR to the domain.
This delivery is performed on the lowest-numbered CMU in the domain.

 XIRs are delivered to a domain either when the SCF CLI for delivering XIRs is used
 or by the SCF software when a domain apparently hangs (first the SCF software
will send a panic request; if this doesn't work, the XIR request is  used).

The system administrator should examine output displayed to the XSCF console, domain's console,
domain logs files (/var/adm/messages, fmdump -v) and XSCF logs files (fmdump -m, fmdump -v) to
gain a further understanding of the problem.


If there is no explanation why the fault occurred, then proceed with the steps outlined below.


       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:44:27 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 4eafe04a-1716-4f6e-aa7a-a708c079a023
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/ SCF-8005-DH for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8005-DH, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:44:27 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 4eafe04a-1716-4f6e-aa7a-a708c079a023
   DESC: A non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a SC chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8005-DH for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Nothing is deconfigured.
   IMPACT: No immediate action is taken as a result of this fault. The domain may not
   be operational. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: The platform administrator should investigate and see if there is some other
   hardware fault that might possibly be related to this fault.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command


        xscf> fmdump -v -u 4eafe04a-1716-4f6e-aa7a-a708c079a023

        TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
        Mar 20 21:44:27.6428 4eafe04a-1716-4f6e-aa7a-a708c079a023 SCF-8005-DH
          100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.sc.se

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/sc=0
                   Affects: -
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                       server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                       part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: No immediate action is taken as a result of this fault. The domain may not be operational. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
event_registry_properties.item: Non-fatal uncorrectable error detected within a SC chip.
